A 30 year previously healthy male came with 2 days fever and cough with purulent sputum. Examination reveals an impaired note with bronchial breathing and crackles and increased vocal resonance. He is alert. Pulse-106/min, BP=100/70. Respiratory rate =24/min. Blood urea=6 mmol/L. Which of the following is the best treatment for him?

options.label: A
options.text: OP treatment with Clarithromycin 500mg BID for one week

options.label: B
options.text: Admit in ward and give Levofloxacin orally 750mg OD + Inj. Ceftriaxone 1G IV BID

options.label: C
options.text: Admit in ICCU and give Inj. Ceftriaxone 2G IV OD + IV levofloxacin 750mg OD

options.label: D
options.text: Admit in wards and give Piperacillin + tazobactam 4.5 G qid

questions.correct_answer: A. OP treatment with Clarithromycin 500mg BID for one week

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Open repair if it is an extraperitoneal injury of the bladder

questions.text: A renal cyst with increased number of septa and prominent calcification in a nonenhancing cyst wall does not require exploration, but requires timely follow-up. According to the Bosniak grading system, this cyst would be categorized as:
The relationship between the upper and lower pole orifices in a complete ureteral duplication is best described by the upper pole:

options.label: A
options.text: Orifice being cephalad and lateral to the lower orifice

options.label: B
options.text: Ureter joining the lower pole ureter just before entry into the bladder

options.label: C
options.text: Orifice being caudal and medial to the lower pole orifice.

options.label: D
options.text: Orifice and lower pole orifice being located transversely side by side

questions.correct_answer: C. Orifice being caudal and medial to the lower pole orifice.

questions.text: Which one of the following devices provides the least amount of adjacent tissue damage during normal usage?
Which of the following statements regarding penile cancer is FALSE?

options.label: A
options.text: Cancer may develop anywhere on the penis.

options.label: B
options.text: Because of the associated discomfort, patients usually present to physicians within the first month of noting the lesion.

options.label: C
options.text: Phimosis may obscure the nature of the lesion.

options.label: D
options.text: Penetration of the Buck fascia and the tunica albuginea by the tumor permits invasion of the vascular corpora

questions.correct_answer: B. Because of the associated discomfort, patients usually present to physicians within the first month of noting the lesion.

questions.text: A 42-year-old man had a CT scan (Fig.) 36 hours after a motor vehicle accident. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 45-year-old female was recently admitted with gallstone pancreatitis and was hospitalized for one week. She is now five weeks out from her admission and is tolerating a low fat diet well. Today at her follow up appointment she denies any abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting. CT performed two days ago revealed a nine cm pancreatic fluid collection suggestive of a pseudocyst, as seen below. Her WBC is 6,000 cells/mm3 and hepatic function panel is within normal limits. Her amylase and lipase are within normal limits. She denies any early satiety or fever.

options.label: D
options.text: Expectant management with repeat imaging in six weeks

questions.correct_answer: D. Expectant management with repeat imaging in six weeks

questions.text: A 54-year-old woman presents to your clinic for further nausea, vomiting and jaundice. On exam, her abdomen is soft, non-tender and not distended. Her sclera are anicteric. Laboratory studies are obtained and reveal a total bilirubin of 1.5 mg/dL, alkaline phosphatase of 24 IU/L, AST 18 IU/L, ALT 19 IU/L. Her MRCP image is shown here. For definitive management, you recommend:

A 40-year-old depressed and schizophrenic man jumps off a three-story window onto the street. Paramedics arrive on scene within 5 min, and he is rushed to the emergency department but loses vitals in the field and is dead on arrival (DOA). What is the most likely cause of death?
A 42-year-old woman presents with bulging eyes and symptoms of hyperthyroidism including palpitations, heat intolerance, and anxiety. What will an iodine uptake scan show?

options.label: A
options.text: No uptake in the thyroid gland

options.label: B
options.text: High uniform uptake throughout both lobes of the thyroid

options.label: C
options.text: High multifocal uptake within both lobes of the thyroid

options.label: D
options.text: High unifocal uptake in the right upper lobe (E) Low uniform uptake in a single lobe

questions.correct_answer: B. High uniform uptake throughout both lobes of the thyroid

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman underwent thyroid lobectomy for a large nodule causing compressive symptoms. FNA preoperatively showed a benign colloid nodule. On final pathology, a 5-mm focus of papillary thyroid cancer is noted. What is the next step in treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Completion thyroidectomy followed by radioactive iodine ablation

options.label: B
options.text: Completion thyroidectomy without radioactive iodine ablation

options.label: C
options.text: Completion thyroidectomy with ipsilateral central neck dissection

questions.text: A 64-year-old man underwent a cholecystectomy for right upper-quadrant pain. Investigations: Cholecystectomy specimen - The muscle wall is thickened with multiple prolapsed glands specimen in the subserosal tissue (Rokitansky–Ashoff sinuses). USG shows following image What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 19-year-old woman presented to the emergency department three hours after ingesting approximately 300 ml of car battery fluid following an argument with her partner. Her abdomen was tender but not peritonitic and there was no palpable surgical emphysema. There were no signs of airway compromise. Which of the following should form part of initial management?

options.label: B
options.text: Endoscopy between 12 and 24 hours of ingestion

options.label: D
options.text: Oral ammonia as a neutralizing agent

questions.correct_answer: B. Endoscopy between 12 and 24 hours of ingestion

questions.text: A 42-year-old man presented to the emergency department with haematemesis and melaena. He had a past medical history of gout and had recently increased his dose of ibuprofen. Investigations: Gastroscopy See Fig. Which Forrest classification best describes this lesion?

On exam- ination, the penis is oedematous and bruised and there is blood at the urethral meatus. He is otherwise stable.Which of the following investigations is indicated?

A newborn female infant is born to a 19-year-old G1P0 mother who smokes. On physical exam, the small bowel is eviscerated through an abdominal wall defect to the right of the umbilicus( shown in fig). The small bowel appears matted and dilated. The infant appears to otherwise be healthy. What is the diagnosis?

A 45-year-old female undergoes screening mammography which demonstrates an area of suspicious microscopic calcification in her right upper outer breast. Stereotactic-guided biopsy confirms ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS). Which of the following is true about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It should be excised to a negative margin.

options.label: B
options.text: It is considered a marker for malignancy in either breast.

options.label: C
options.text: The cribriform type has a worse prognosis than the comedo type.

options.label: D
options.text: Radiation therapy is an acceptable alternative to surgical excision.

questions.correct_answer: A. It should be excised to a negative margin.

questions.text: A 45-year-old female presents with dyspepsia for three months. She reports pain in the epigastrium that is not related to eating. She denies nausea, vomiting, and heartburn. She has not had weight loss. A stool H. pylori antigen test is found to be positive and the patient is treated with quadruple therapy with complete resolution of her symptoms. As part of the evaluation, a right upper quadrant ultrasound was performed and revealed a 12mm fixed, hyperechoic shadowing defect in the gallbladder(fig). No gallstones were present. What is the best next step?

options.label: D
options.text: Repeat ultrasound in six to12 months

questions.text: Genitourinary tuberculosis in a male patient is suggested by which of the following findings?
A 36-year-old man presents to the emergency room with renal colic. A Radiograph reveals a 1.5- cm stone. Which of the following statements regarding this disorder is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Conservative treatment including hydration and analgesics will not result in a satisfactory outcome

options.label: B
options.text: Serial kidney, ureter, bladder (KUB) radiographs should be used to follow this patient

options.label: C
options.text: The urinalysis will nearly always reveal microhematuria

options.label: D
options.text: When the acute event is correctly treated, this disease seldom recurs

questions.correct_answer: A. Conservative treatment including hydration and analgesics will not result in a satisfactory outcome

questions.correct_answer: A. Burn of 20% TBSA or greater

questions.text: 32-year-old newlywed man presents to the emergency department with intense pain in his penis. He reports having an accident falling in the bathroom. His tempera- ture is 37.7 °C, blood pressure is 126/80 mmHg, and pulse is 110/min. His physical examination is significant for a blue discoloration at the base of a swollen and deviated penis. He has no ulcers or discharge. Retrograde urethrogram did not identify any urethral injuries. What is the best next step for this patient?

A 23-year-old man presents to the emergency depart- ment after an altercation in which he sustained trauma to his head and neck.
